trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: Use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder connector to interop between flat file data (for example, an Excel or CSV file) and XML data.
trans-unit.target: Use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder connector to interop between flat file data (for example, an Excel or CSV file) and XML data.

trans-unit.source: It can convert a given flat file instance to XML and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: It can convert a given flat file instance to XML and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: To use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder, you need to first create an instance of the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder, you need to first create an instance of the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Here are the steps to create a BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: Here are the steps to create a BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: Log into the Azure portal (http://portal.azure.com)
trans-unit.target: Log into the Azure portal (http://portal.azure.com)

trans-unit.source: Select New > Marketplace > Everything
trans-unit.target: Select New > Marketplace > Everything

trans-unit.source: Search for "BizTalk Flat File Encoder" in the search box
trans-unit.target: Search for "BizTalk Flat File Encoder" in the search box

trans-unit.source: Select BizTalk Flat File Encoder from the list of results
trans-unit.target: Select BizTalk Flat File Encoder from the list of results

trans-unit.source: Select "Create" then provide a name and the other required details
trans-unit.target: Select "Create" then provide a name and the other required details

trans-unit.source: Select "Create".
trans-unit.target: Select "Create".

trans-unit.source: You will be redirected to the start page where you can see the creation progress.
trans-unit.target: You will be redirected to the start page where you can see the creation progress.

trans-unit.source: This may take a while to complete.
trans-unit.target: This may take a while to complete.

trans-unit.source: You will receive a notification when it completes.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a notification when it completes.

trans-unit.source: Configure BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: Configure BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: After the API app has been created, you can launch it either directly from the Azure portal start page or from the designer's surface when creating a Logic app.
trans-unit.target: After the API app has been created, you can launch it either directly from the Azure portal start page or from the designer's surface when creating a Logic app.

trans-unit.source: To launch it from the Azure start page you can search for it by typing the name you gave to the BizTalk Flat File Encoder when you created it.
trans-unit.target: To launch it from the Azure start page you can search for it by typing the name you gave to the BizTalk Flat File Encoder when you created it.

trans-unit.source: You do this by:
trans-unit.target: You do this by:

trans-unit.source: Entering the name of your BizTalk Flat File Encoder in the search box on the Auzre portal and searching for it
trans-unit.target: Entering the name of your BizTalk Flat File Encoder in the search box on the Auzre portal and searching for it

trans-unit.source: Next, select your BizTalk Flat File Encoder from the list.
trans-unit.target: Next, select your BizTalk Flat File Encoder from the list.

trans-unit.source: This opens up the API App blade where you can configure your BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.
trans-unit.target: This opens up the API App blade where you can configure your BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.

trans-unit.source: To start the configuration, you'll want to add a schema by:
trans-unit.target: To start the configuration, you'll want to add a schema by:

trans-unit.source: Selecting the "Schemas" component
trans-unit.target: Selecting the "Schemas" component

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder Schemas Part
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder Schemas Part

trans-unit.source: Then selecting "Add New" on the Schemas blade that opens up
trans-unit.target: Then selecting "Add New" on the Schemas blade that opens up

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions

trans-unit.source: Select one of the three options to provide your schema.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the three options to provide your schema.

trans-unit.source: The options are UPLOAD NEW SCHEMA, GENERATE FROM JSON AND GENERATE FROM FLAT FILE
trans-unit.target: The options are UPLOAD NEW SCHEMA, GENERATE FROM JSON AND GENERATE FROM FLAT FILE

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps to provide your schema, based on your selection in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps to provide your schema, based on your selection in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: You'll then see the that the schema has been uploaded:
trans-unit.target: You'll then see the that the schema has been uploaded:

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions

trans-unit.source: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder in design surface
trans-unit.target: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder in design surface

trans-unit.source: Now that you've configured the Biztalk Flat File Encoder, its time to use it in a Logic app.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've configured the Biztalk Flat File Encoder, its time to use it in a Logic app.

trans-unit.source: To get started, either create a new Logic app, our launch an existing one that you've created beforehand then follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To get started, either create a new Logic app, our launch an existing one that you've created beforehand then follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: On the 'Start logic' card, click 'Run this logic manually'.
trans-unit.target: On the 'Start logic' card, click 'Run this logic manually'.

trans-unit.source: Select the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API App you created earlier in the gallery (You will find the BizTalk Flat File Encoder you created in the API Apps list on the right of your screen.).
trans-unit.target: Select the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API App you created earlier in the gallery (You will find the BizTalk Flat File Encoder you created in the API Apps list on the right of your screen.).

trans-unit.source: Select the black right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the black right arrow.

trans-unit.source: The two available actions (Flat File to Xml and Xml to Flat File) are presented:
trans-unit.target: The two available actions (Flat File to Xml and Xml to Flat File) are presented:

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below, based on your the action you select.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below, based on your the action you select.

trans-unit.source: Flat File to Xml
trans-unit.target: Flat File to Xml
